summary: This document is an email chain from July 25, 2019, forwarding a report from the U.S. Marshals Service about an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The report states that on the morning of July 24, 2019, Epstein was found in his cell with a noose around his neck and was placed on suicide watch. The incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the report; found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.context: The AW at MCC New York who advised the U.S. Marshals Service of the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal
persons.context: The official from the Southern District of New York who sent the initial report about the Epstein incident to the email recipients.

connections.description: The Associate Warden at MCC New York was responsible for reporting the incident involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck. He was escorted to medical, assessed, and initially placed on suicide watch, then downgraded to suicide observation.

events.title: Cell Mate Threat Report
events.description: Epstein's cell mate reported being threatened to be killed. No further information was provided.

events.title: BOP Investigation Initiated
events.description: The incident involving Epstein is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York on the morning of July 24, 2019, with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was placed on suicide watch and then downgraded to suicide observation following the incident.
Epstein's cell mate reported being threatened to be killed, though no further details were provided.
The incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.
The report was forwarded via email on July 25, 2019, by the U.S. Marshals Service, indicating internal communication about Epstein's welfare in custody.
